Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Use qname as storage for attribute" (#1158) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "Use qname as storage for attribute" (#1158) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "Create separate features for statically typed classes" (#1155) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This is an initial attempt at separating out the infrastructure for
statically typed classes from the framework. This updates things to
start explicitly depending on the generated classes if they are needed.
Over time, we should be able to separate out the generated classes into
their own assembly and keep a "framework" of OpenXml related
functionality.

Merged pull request "Add M365 updates from May 2022" (#1151) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "Support for modern comments in presentation files?" (#1133) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: I've recently implemented support for comments in my code (finding comment XML via the SlideCommentsPart property of SlidePart) but I've noticed that it doesn't pick up "modern" comments which apparently were implemented in Office 365 starting in late 2020 or early 2021. Is support for this on the roadmap to be added to the SDK, or should I roll my own solution?

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "move PowerPointCommentPart relationship to SlidePart" (#1137) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This commit corrects the relationship between PowerPointCommentPart (modern comments) and SlidePart. This fixes #1133.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error if backslashes in zip path" (#1128) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

When reading an OpenXml file that uses backslashes (instead of forward slashes) in the Zip paths: 
then OpenXml will not open the file and will throw an error
```
  The specified package is invalid. The main part is missing.
   at DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPackage.Load(Package package)
```
_Open XML SDK 2.5 Productivity Tool_
gives this message: "Cannot open the file: The specified file type is not supported."

The Zip spec says forward slash "should" be used.
Almost everything (Office, Explorer, 7-Zip, SharpZipLib) handles and normalizes the slashes.
(System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage and LibreOffice do not)

**Information**

- .NET Framework 4.7.2
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml 2.15.0

**Repro**

Xslx file is generated by a 3rd party app. (is a dotNet app, but I don't know what they're using to generate the file)
Problem reading can be observed with System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage

```csharp
var package = System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage.Open(file);
var parts = package.GetParts(); //< returns null for the bad backslash file
``` 

[Zip-Ada](https://sourceforge.net/projects/unzip-ada/) shows the real slashes
```
 xl/sharedStrings.xml
 docProps/core.xml
 docProps/app.xml
~~~~~
 xl\sharedStrings.xml
 docProps\core.xml
 docProps\app.xml
```

[slash.xlsx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/8093343/slash.xlsx)
[backslash.xlsx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/8093342/backslash.xlsx)
